name: Rosace Reimagined
description: Recreation/inspiration of Vera Moln√°r's Computer rosace-series (1974). The version to the left is just a simple recreation, with straight lines. The version to the right has a bit more variation, with wiggly lines that randomizes every time you click on it. Additionally, there's a slider to control the rotation of the squares.

name: 10 PRINT Recreation v1
description: Recreation of the original 10 PRINT artwork by Nick Montfort. A tutorial made by Generative Artistry was used to understand the logic behind the code. The artwork is generated by randomizing between two diagonal lines, creating a maze-like pattern.

name: 10 PRINT Recreation v2
description: Version 2 of the 10 PRINT recreation. This version builds the artwork tile by tile, with a slight delay between each tile being drawn. This actually resembles the way the original 10 PRINT program would have generated the pattern on a Commodore 64, where the pattern would appear gradually as the program ran. This can be showcased in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9joBLOZVEo
